ggoce 0.0.0.9000

Prepare 'oce' objects as data frames for 'ggplot2'

Source: R/fortify.R
fortify.ctd.Rd

Prepare 'oce' objects as data frames for 'ggplot2'

# S3 method for ctd
fortify(model, ..., which = c("data", "combined", "metadata"))

# S3 method for section
fortify(model, ..., which = c("combined", "metadata", "data"))

# S3 method for adp
fortify(
  model,
  ...,
  type = c("velocity", "bottom_track", "metadata"),
  which = c("combined", "metadata", "data")
)

Arguments

model

An 'oce' object
...

Additional columns/values to initialize. Tidy evaluation is supported.
which

Most objects can be summarised as data frames at several levels of granularity. The default is the most useful for plotting.
type

For adp objects, one of "velocity" (one row per time per beam per cell), "bottom_track" (one row per time per beam), or "metadata" (one row per time).

Value

A tibble::tibble()

Examples

library(ggplot2)
data(ctd, package = "oce")
fortify(ctd)
